name: Japanese Cosmo Pearl No5 Thread Series 1-4
description:
Lecien has been marketing COSMO threads since 1950. Today COSMO holds the No.1 position of total thread sales in the Japanese market. 

COSMO is the brand of thread used in many Japanese temari pattern books. This thread sells elsewhere for $4.00 per skein.

This beautiful cotton thread is used in the COSMO series of temari books. COSMO threads are strong but soft and resistant to tangling, this makes them delightful to stitch with. The superior dyeing techniques used by Leicen have created threads that have an amazing level of color retention.

The 250+ colours in this range are simply gorgeous. Our price makes them less expensive than DMC or Anchor skeins and of equal, if not better, quality.

See the second image for colours. 

25m skeins of single strand, 2 ply 100% cotton.

The colours highlighted with blue are in stock all other colours may be ordered (minimum order 3 skeins of each colour) but could take several weeks to arrive. 

Want to see the colours in real life? Select the option at the bottom of the drop down list on any thread page to purchase your own colour swatch made with real threads.

Shipping: within Australia single item $4.00, with others items $0.25.  International Shipping charged at current Australia Post Prices - a separate invoice will be sent to your paypal account.

name: Nordic Gold Threads by Rainbow Gallery
description:
This is our favorite marking and stitching thread.  It is the perfect companion to the Rayon thread for your temari projects.

Stronger than a blending filament and finer than a braid, this chainette thread comes in a lovely range of colours.

Nordic Gold is a very fine chainette metallic. This construction gives them a soft hand but can make them a bit difficult to work with at first. However, practice solves the problem of the chainette unraveling. There are several things to do to gain control of these yarns. You can use a larger than normal needle, be careful not to drag the yarn. The larger needle makes a bigger hole for the yarn to pass through and there will be less friction on it. You might also try a smaller than normal needle as this tends to set the yarn in the needle and it will not run beyond the small eye of the needle. It is not the end of the world when the yarn unravels. Cut ahead of the raveled part and rethread your needle. Chainettes are softer and less expensive than braids. They plump up and cover the ball better. These advantages far outweigh the initial difficulty you might find.

If you hate to ply-up blending filament this will work well and you will not have the trouble with it curling and fighting you while you stitch. It is about the size of 2-3 plies of filament. 

This is the cheapest price that can be found in Australia for this range.  Postage within Australia is $4.00 for a single item or $0.50 when shipped with other items.  Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order. 


(1 strand 18-24 count)

Want to see the Colours in Real Life? Select "Real Thread Swatch Set" Option below.

The threads we sell are the most gorgeous available for temari making, but sometimes it can be very difficult to choose a colour from your computer screen. Nothing can compare to seeing and feeling a thread in real life. We now offer colour swatch cards using actual thread for our ranges so you can select the perfect colour for your temari every time. Contains all 13 current colours on 1 card strip.

name: Cosmo Metallic Thread
description:
100m of 33% polyester 67% rayon metallic thread made by Leicen. This thread has been requested by customers that had previously purchase it while visiting Japan. It does not have the same stretch properties that Nordic Gold has. 


Shipping $5.00 alone or $0.50 with other items within Australia Due to the thread being on a spool this ships as a package for postage.
Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: Treasure Braid Petite by Rainbow Gallery
description:
Treasure Braid Petite from Rainbow Gallery is perfect for marking C8, C10 and higher divisions. It is a very fine thread which can be combined with other threads for added sparkle. 

It is a three ply braided metallic that is extremely versatile. There is 22.5metres/25yards per card. It can usually replace a #4 braid. It is very durable and should not present any problem when stitching. It is great to use when you want to add a glimmer of metallic without overpowering the rest of your stitching. You also may double or triple it in the needle when you want braids that are equal to a #6 or #9 weight. 

Available in 73 Regular colours, 13 Hi Gloss Colours and 9 Shimmer colours, all shades marked with * in the menu are colour matched to Nordic Gold (great for adding those additional support lines).
Shades not appearing in the menu are not part of our regular range but may be special ordered (minimum order 3 cards of each colour). They may take several weeks to arrive.

(For very fine work when doing needlepoint) 
(14-36 count cross stitch or combined with other threads)
Postage within Australia is $4.00 for a single item or $0.50 when shipped with other items.  Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order. 

Want to see these threads in Real Life? Order the "Real Thread Swatch Set" option below.

The threads we sell are the most gorgeous available for temari making, but sometimes it can be very difficult to choose a colour from your computer screen. Nothing can compare to seeing and feeling a thread in real life. We now offer colour swatch cards using actual thread for our ranges so you can select the perfect colour for your temari every time. All 73 current colours plus 13 High Gloss and 9 shimmer colours on 7 card strips.

name: V-ruler
description:
A V-ruler is highly useful in the art of temari making. Made in Japan by the Japanese Temari Association, it is designed for marking C10 poles, but it can be used in many other ways. 
Use it to mark out the divisions for S10 and checking the obi placement (also on any other S division up to 10cm diameter). Measure away from any guide pin to place stitches and guidelines without adding extra pins to the ball. Just hook the crook on a pin and swing it around. This eliminates the need to juggle your ball, pins and measuring tape/paper.

The V ruler comes with an information/ready reckoner card to help you quickly mark 10-45cm circumference balls into C10. The card also holds your ruler to keep it flat while not in use.

The V-ruler is 8cm long with markings at every mm, cm and a handy triangle at the 5cm line.

The rulers are offered at cost as agreed by the JTA in Tokyo.

Postage is $1.50 (free with any other item) within Australia.  Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: Temari Base - Simple Divisions
description:
Want to make temari but not sure how to make the base? Can't tell what it should be like from the picture in a book? Maybe you just want to skip to the fun part.

Let us make the base for you.

Bases are approximately 25cm in circumference and are wrapped in Red, White or Black thread.  Several division options available please make your selection from the drop down menu.

The balls are made from traditional rice hull and divided with our lovely nordic gold thread in ND 1 on White, ND2 on Red and ND3 on Black.

Other colours may be requested, but as they will be a custom order the temari elves may need a day or so to wrap them for you. Just ask.

Postage within Australia is $6.00 for a single item or $3.00 when ordered with other items. This item is not available for postage outside of Australia

name: Temari wrapping thread 3pk
description:
Power wrap your way to temari heaven with these 3 packs of thread. This thread is not slippery and gives a nice semi-sheen to the temari surface

Each spool contains 1000m of thread.

More colours will be added.

Within Australia the postage is $5.00 when shipped alone and $1.00 when shipped with other items. Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: Temari Tools & Display
description:
Clover Palm Thimble:
Like to use long needles but dislike the way they rub on your palm? Here's the perfect solution! Clover's adjustable ring thimble with plate will protect you palm as you stitch.  See image page 3.

Berry Pins:
Package of 100 coloured plastic pins. There are 7 colours in these packs. See image page 3.

Tekobari style groomer (BLT): 
This is from Rainbow Gallery and produced by Shay Pendray. Approx 9.5 cm long with a squared handle which tapers into a pointed tip with a slightly textured surface that gently grips the threads to groom them into place. I used to use the back of my needle for grooming my stitching until I got this excellent little tool, I highly recommend it. Comes in a plastic storage tube. See image page 3.

Temari Ring Stand:
Do your temari like to wobble and roll? Keep them still while resting them on your work table with these low profile clear acrylic rings. Small size 30mm (3 mm tall) large size 40mm (5mm tall). Sold as single items or mixed sets of 8 (4 of each size)

These are totally clear and can be used alone or two of the same size can be stacked together for holding your temari on permanent display. You could even wrap them in matching thread to create a coordinated stand. See images in page 2.


Postage within Australia: alone $4.50, with another item $1.00
Overseas postage: is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: Very Velvet Petite Thread by Rainbow Gallery
description:
Very Velvet Petite is a fuzzy, beautiful velour yarn. This creates temari that feel so soft and luxurious. It maintains its shape and thickness throughout its length. Use a rather large needle and a short tail. It does not come apart while stitching, but it may shred behind the eye of the needle. If this happens move the needle forward a half inch or so and it will not unthread. Very Velvet is colorfast and should not bleed, however, always test first. If your test produces some color it is likely some of the fine hairs pulled out. These can be flicked away leaving no dye behind. The color should remain consistent with very little dye lot variations. 

When preparing this fiber to be stitched, take a length off the card and run your fingernail over it a couple of times. This should remove any kinks and any excess flakes.  Avoid taking your underground stitches through the foam or hull core of your temari.

(Needlepoint 18 count, Cross Stitch 9&10 Count and over two on 18 Count)

Colours in the image begin with V2.. but are actually stocked as V6.. for petite  threads.  All shades may not be in stock but can be special ordered... it may take several weeks to arrive.

The postage within Australia is $3.00 for a single item or $0.50 when shipped with other items.  Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: 1st Temari Video Tutorial Set
description:
This tutorial series shows you all the steps to make your very first temari. Many people learn temari making from printed text (books or internet) but the best lesson ever is when you are lucky enough to have someone demonstrating how to do it.  

There are five live action video episodes (not a bunch of photos sequenced together) demonstrating every step from how to prepare the temari base through to measuring & marking out with pins into an eight section and laying the guideline threads.  This series shows you how to make a classic, simple obi and includes two traditional pole designs using Herringbone stitch.  

Use two designs on the same ball or make two temari using one design on each. 

A handy temari supply shopping list, history, colour & motif  information and a printable copy of the instructions are also included on the disk. 

More than 40 minutes of learning on 5 videos.

The tutorials are WMV  files and play on windows media player.  (You may be able to download a converter from the internet... and if you are a mac user you probably already know how or have done it.) 

Postage within Australia is $5.00 alone and $1.00 with other items. Overseas postage is quoted and charged separately based on the weight of your order.

name: Gift Vouchers
description:
Are you busy dropping birthday hints? Know someone that loves temari but not sure what goodies they would like to have? 

Here's the perfect solution! Temari Addict Australia Gift Vouchers!

Sold in multiples of $20, just select your gift voucher total from the drop down list. They are listed by desired reaction...er... dollar value.

The vouchers are printed on Vellum Temari Addict Australia paper and fixed with eyelets to a metallic cardboard card. Presented in a pearlised envelope for giving, these vouchers can be posted directly to the recipient or to your own address.

All vouchers have a 12 month expiry from the issue date and can be redeemed through our store using the unique voucher number in the discount section of the shopping cart.

name: $20 Temari Book Range - Cosmo Series
description:
Books in this range include:

4837702795 1Yasashii (Easy) Cosmo 1
4837702805 Sousaku (Creative) Cosmo 2 24837702813 Atarashii (New) Cosmo 3  34837702821 Atarashii (New) Cosmo 4 4837702832 Atarashii (New) Cosmo 5 483770784x Atarashii (New) Cosmo 6 64837708854 Atarashii (New) Cosmo 7 

These books, written in Japanese by temari master Ozaki Sensei, are affectionately known as the Cosmo series 1-7.  Once you've worked through the English language books by authors such as Suess and Vandervoort this is the place to look for further inspiration.  Books one and two have step by step how to photos and all the books have diagrams to show how to complete many of the projects.  This series will give you so much inspiration for your temari making.

Browse page 2 and 3 for photos of cover images. 

Our prices are much cheaper than you will find on Ebay and all books are fresh from the publisher.  No second hand books here. name: Temari 102 and 103 Classes
description:
Now you know the basics, continue to expand your skills in temari making. Each course will allow you to learn 4 new designs and You will create 3 temari. Courses are 3 two hour lessons conducted over 3 or 6 weeks. Note Temari 101 is a prerequisite for Temari 102. Temari 102 must be completed prior to enrolling in Temari 103. 
These courses run subject to minimum of 4 and maximum of 6 students. 
BYO kit - details available on registration. Please select your course from the list below. Class fee is just $10 per hour. 
Organise a group to schedule your course at any time. Classes conducted in Perth Metro (Australia) only.

name: Temari 101 Class
description:
Discover basics of temari making.  Learn about the history of temari making and how to gather your supplies.  Learn about preparing, wrapping and simple divisions.  See 4 stitching techniques and complete 3 temari balls.

A full kit is supplied, just bring a pair of scissors.  Three 2 hour lessons conducted over 3 or 6 weeks.  No prior embroidery experience is required - if you can stitch on a button you can make temari.  

Fee $90 (inclusive $30 kit including everything you'll need except scissors)  Four to six students per class - make up a group of friends to schedule your class anytime.  Classes conducted in Perth Metro (Australia) only.  Class fee is just $10 per hour.

options.name: I got my group let's start now
